bibl.title: Letter from Edward Champe Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, August 30, 1911 [Enclosed in C0127043]

div1.p: Carter expresses his relief upon graduation and receiving letters of recommendation.

div1.head: Letter from Edward Champe Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, August 30, 1911 [Enclosed in C0127043]

opener.dateline:
N. J. Marine Hospital,
Louisville, Ky. Aug. 30, 1911.
Wednesday.

div1.p:
I am through! Today
I got my “certificate of graduation to
be exact, and besides that there
dandy letters of recommendation,
from Mr. Miller, Mr. Liberartz
and Miss Fox. Mr. Mayor will
give me his tomorrow. I will keep
on at the school to the end of the
week, I am paid up thru Jan, and
will then stop and help to pack.

You see I will stay at N.R.
for a month or six weeks and then
if Dad can get me a “job” in Humer-
enler, I will join you folks - and he
thinks he can. all used love.
